item.title: nftables - basics
item.description: short update: 2024-04-20 nftables is the modern linux kernel (>= 3.13 nft support) packet classification framework to replace iptables. iptables is not covered in this essay. you need such packet filters in firewalls and routers to accept, drop or forward network packets. this post will deal the basics of nftables and show some commands/rules to handle rules and configure this rules in your linux system. in particular, a nixos system and its configuration are discussed but these rules apply to most systems with nftables.
